intro: Palicourea wurdackii, commonly known as the golden leaf vine, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found growing along stream banks and in dense undergrowth. Palicourea wurdackii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
